messages.content:
Hi, I am Plugin Pal - your WordPress plugin assistant!
 To begin, please describe the plugin you want to create.
Create a plugin that displays a carousel of images of cats on my page.

Got it! Quick questions so we place it correctly: which page(s) should the cat carousel appear on, and should the images come from your own uploads or be pulled automatically from a public cat image source? If you have a preferred autoplay speed or want autoplay off, let me know.

requirements.name: Cat Carousel
requirements.description: Displays a carousel of cat images on selected page(s).
requirements.details: Provide a simple image carousel featuring cats. Site owner can choose the images and their order, add captions, and the carousel will loop with next/previous controls and optional autoplay. It should be responsive on mobile and desktop, support pausing on hover, and use the image captions for alt text. Include a lightweight settings screen to manage images and basic options (show arrows, show dots, autoplay on/off, autoplay speed). Allow placing the carousel on chosen page(s) without affecting the rest of the site.

messages.content: Let it autoplay and get the images from upsplash or something appearing on my homepage at the bottom near the footer.
Perfect—autoplaying cat photos at the bottom of your homepage it is, using a public source like Unsplash. I’ll proceed with these details now; please sit tight while we generate your plugin.

requirements.name: Cat Carousel
requirements.description: Autoplaying cat image carousel on the homepage.
requirements.details: Display a responsive, looping carousel of cat images automatically at the bottom of the homepage, just above the footer. Images are fetched from a public image source (Unsplash preferred) and show subtle attribution/credit when available. Carousel autoplays by default (3s per slide), pauses on hover, and includes next/previous arrows and dots. Include a simple settings screen to control: image source/API key if needed, number of images (default 10), autoplay on/off (default on), autoplay speed, and toggles for arrows/dots. Use sensible alt text from the source when available. Do not affect other pages.

messages.content:
I've created your plugin, packaged as a zip, ready to download and install!. Here are some instructions on how to get started with it:
In your WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins > Add New > Upload Plugin, upload the ZIP we sent, then Activate it. The carousel will automatically appear at the bottom of your homepage; to customize it, go to Settings > Cat Carousel to set image count, autoplay, arrows/dots, and (optionally) choose “Unsplash API” and paste your Access Key for enhanced attributions. Visit your homepage to see the carousel live.
'''
